{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Business Operations & Data Analyst",
  "description": "Elizabeth Maddeux Limited -&nbsp;Our client in the Pharmaceutical industry, is&nbsp;recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Posiiton: Business Operations &amp; Data Analyst
Job Location:&nbsp;Egbeda, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	They are seeking to hire a Business Operations &amp; Data Analyst who will help optimize business processes, analyze data, and provide actionable insights to support strategic decisions.
	The ideal candidate is analytical, detail-oriented, and has a strong understanding of data-driven business solutions.


Key Responsibilities


	Collect, analyze, and interpret business data to identify trends and insights.
	Develop and maintain reports and dashboards to monitor key business metrics.
	Support operational efficiency by identifying gaps and recommending process improvements.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to optimize workflows and procedures.
	Ensure accuracy, consistency, and integrity of data.
	Assist in forecasting, budgeting, and performance tracking.
	Present findings and recommendations to management in a clear and actionable manner.


Requirements


	1 - 3 years of experience in business analysis, data analytics, or operations.
	Proficient in Excel, SQL, and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
	Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills.
	Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
	Ability to work independently in a remote environment and manage multiple priorities.


Key Competencies:


	Data Analysis &amp; Interpretation
	Business Operations Optimization
	Reporting &amp; Documentation
	Problem Solving &amp; Initiative
	Communication &amp; Collaboration


Salary
N150,000 Monthly.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruit@elizabethmaddeux.com&nbsp;using &ldquo;Business Operations &amp; Data Analyst&rdquo; as the subject of the email.

Note:&nbsp;Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.",
  "datePosted": "2025-12-05",
  "validThrough": "2025-12-21",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Elizabeth Maddeux Limited"
    
  },

    "@type": "Place",

      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "191438"
  },

    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",

      "minValue": 150000,
      "maxValue": 250000,

Business Operations & Data Analyst Job at Elizabeth Maddeux Limited




        
    

        
        Elizabeth Maddeux Limited - Our client in the Pharmaceutical industry, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Posiiton: Business Operations & Data Analyst
Job Location: Egbeda, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	They are seeking to hire a Business Operations & Data Analyst who will help optimize business processes, analyze data, and provide actionable insights to support strategic decisions.
	The ideal candidate is analytical, detail-oriented, and has a strong understanding of data-driven business solutions.


Key Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Collect, analyze, and interpret business data to identify trends and insights.
	Develop and maintain reports and dashboards to monitor key business metrics.
	Support operational efficiency by identifying gaps and recommending process improvements.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to optimize workflows and procedures.
	Ensure accuracy, consistency, and integrity of data.
	Assist in forecasting, budgeting, and performance tracking.
	Present findings and recommendations to management in a clear and actionable manner.


Requirements


	1 - 3 years of experience in business analysis, data analytics, or operations.
	Proficient in Excel, SQL, and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
	Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills.
	Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
	Ability to work independently in a remote environment and manage multiple priorities.


Key Competencies:


	Data Analysis & Interpretation
	Business Operations Optimization
	Reporting & Documentation
	Problem Solving & Initiative
	Communication & Collaboration


Salary
N150,000 Monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruit@elizabethmaddeux.com using “Business Operations & Data Analyst” as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Senior Copywriter",
  "description": "Oconsulting Limited, an independent HR consulting firm, is&nbsp;recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Copywriter

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Advertising, Marketing &amp; Creative Content Production

Job Description


	We are seeking to engage a senior Copy writer, the ideal candidate is a creative thinker with an eye for storytelling, strong understanding of brand communication, and proven experience developing compelling copy across digital and traditional platforms.
	You must be able to translate briefs into bold, engaging ideas that align with each brand&rsquo;s tone and audience.


Responsibilities


	Develop clear, persuasive, and original copy for campaigns, social media, website content, and brand communication.
	Collaborate closely with the Creative Team (Design, Social Media, Art Direction) to craft integrated campaign concepts.
	Interpret creative briefs and propose innovative ideas that align with client objectives.
	Edit and proofread copy to ensure accuracy, consistency, and brand alignment.
	Work under tight deadlines while maintaining quality and creativity.
	Participate in brainstorming sessions and contribute strategic, insight-driven ideas.
	Research industry trends, consumer insights, and competitors to strengthen content direction.
	Maintain a consistent tone of voice across all communication deliverables


Requirements


	Minimum of 4+ years of experience in a creative/advertising/marketing agency
	Strong portfolio demonstrating campaign copy, social media content, and brand storytelling.
	Excellent writing, editing, and proofreading skills.
	Strong understanding of digital communication and social platforms.
	Creativity, originality, attention to detail, and strong communication skills.
	Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.


Salary
Open.",

Senior Copywriter Job at Oconsulting Limited




        
    

        
        Oconsulting Limited, an independent HR consulting firm, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Copywriter

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Advertising, Marketing & Creative Content Production

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking to engage a senior Copy writer, the ideal candidate is a creative thinker with an eye for storytelling, strong understanding of brand communication, and proven experience developing compelling copy across digital and traditional platforms.
	You must be able to translate briefs into bold, engaging ideas that align with each brand’s tone and audience.


Responsibilities


	Develop clear, persuasive, and original copy for campaigns, social media, website content, and brand communication.
	Collaborate closely with the Creative Team (Design, Social Media, Art Direction) to craft integrated campaign concepts.
	Interpret creative briefs and propose innovative ideas that align with client objectives.
	Edit and proofread copy to ensure accuracy, consistency, and brand alignment.
	Work under tight deadlines while maintaining quality and creativity.
	Participate in brainstorming sessions and contribute strategic, insight-driven ideas.
	Research industry trends, consumer insights, and competitors to strengthen content direction.
	Maintain a consistent tone of voice across all communication deliverables


Requirements


	Minimum of 4+ years of experience in a creative/advertising/marketing agency
	Strong portfolio demonstrating campaign copy, social media content, and brand storytelling.
	Excellent writing, editing, and proofreading skills.
	Strong understanding of digital communication and social platforms.
	Creativity, originality, attention to detail, and strong communication skills.
	Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.


Salary
Open.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Utility Technician",
  "description": "Grand Oak Limited is part of a team committed to working together across companies. Only by sharing ideas, technologies and talents can the Group achieve and sustain profitable growth Keeping Commitment. We believe that following through on promises is the best way to maintain credibility with colleagues, employees and customers Continuous Improvement.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Utility Technician

Job Location:&nbsp;Sango Ota, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Principal Accountabilities


	Perform regular inspections, maintenance passes, and servicing of utility systems such as HVAC, cooling towers, compressors, and generators to ensure optimal performance longevity and zero downtime of all utility equipment.
	Respond promptly to utility system breakdowns and perform necessary repairs to minimize production downtime and maintain continuous plant operation.
	Carry out regular safety inspections to ensure that all utility systems comply with relevant safety regulations and standards.
	Collaborate with all teams to provide support and meet their utility needs so as to ensure seamless factory operation.
	Supervise the activities of Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) and external contractors on company grounds to ensure compliance with standards, timely completion of projects, and quality of work.
	Maintain accurate records of equipment status, maintenance activities, repairs, system performance, and incidents for proper monitoring and to keep management informed


Challenges:


	Manpower shortage
	Availability of spares


Planning &amp; Organising:


	Macro: Weekly Micro: Daily


Context of Job


	Framework &amp; Boundaries: The Utility Technician operates within a framework of established SOPs, safety protocols, and regulatory compliance, maintaining accurate records and collaborating with production teams, OEMs, and contractors.&nbsp;Boundaries include obtaining approvals for major decisions from the Utility Division in charge, managing resources within budget constraints, ensuring safety and compliance, and focusing on maintaining utility systems such as HVAC, cooling towers, compressors, and generators.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess an OND / HND with 2-3 years of experience.


Salary
N200,000 - N300,000 / Month.",
  "datePosted": "2025-12-05",
  "validThrough": "2025-12-31",

Utility Technician Job at Grand Oak Limited




        
    

        
        Grand Oak Limited is part of a team committed to working together across companies. Only by sharing ideas, technologies and talents can the Group achieve and sustain profitable growth Keeping Commitment. We believe that following through on promises is the best way to maintain credibility with colleagues, employees and customers Continuous Improvement.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Utility Technician

Job Location: Sango Ota, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Principal Accountabilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Perform regular inspections, maintenance passes, and servicing of utility systems such as HVAC, cooling towers, compressors, and generators to ensure optimal performance longevity and zero downtime of all utility equipment.
	Respond promptly to utility system breakdowns and perform necessary repairs to minimize production downtime and maintain continuous plant operation.
	Carry out regular safety inspections to ensure that all utility systems comply with relevant safety regulations and standards.
	Collaborate with all teams to provide support and meet their utility needs so as to ensure seamless factory operation.
	Supervise the activities of Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) and external contractors on company grounds to ensure compliance with standards, timely completion of projects, and quality of work.
	Maintain accurate records of equipment status, maintenance activities, repairs, system performance, and incidents for proper monitoring and to keep management informed


Challenges:


	Manpower shortage
	Availability of spares


Planning & Organising:


	Macro: Weekly Micro: Daily


Context of Job


	Framework & Boundaries: The Utility Technician operates within a framework of established SOPs, safety protocols, and regulatory compliance, maintaining accurate records and collaborating with production teams, OEMs, and contractors. Boundaries include obtaining approvals for major decisions from the Utility Division in charge, managing resources within budget constraints, ensuring safety and compliance, and focusing on maintaining utility systems such as HVAC, cooling towers, compressors, and generators.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess an OND / HND with 2-3 years of experience.


Salary
N200,000 - N300,000 / Month.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Fiber Splicing Technician",
  "description": "Reime West Africa is afully owned subsidiary of a global brand with head office at Casablanca in Morocco that provides Telecom Infrastructure Development and Maintenance Services to Telecom companies in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Fiber Splicing Technician

Job Location:&nbsp;Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports to: OSP Splicing Supervisor

Job Summary


	We are hiring Fiber Optic Splicing Technicians to perform fiber splicing and testing on our customer FTTH deployment project in Ibadan.
	The technician will be responsible for ensuring accurate connections, low-loss joints, and high-quality signal delivery through field splicing activities.


Key Responsibilities


	Perform fusion splicing of optical fibers in ODFs, handholes, closures, and cabinets.
	Execute OTDR, power meter, and light source testing after splicing.
	Follow fiber jointing plans, splicing schedules, and color codes accurately.
	Install and organize fiber closures, splitters, pigtails, and splice trays.
	Ensure proper documentation of splice points, fiber routing, and test results.
	Troubleshoot and correct fiber signal loss or mismatches.
	Work closely with the splicing supervisor to meet daily targets.
	Maintain splicing tools and equipment in good condition.
	Adhere to safety guidelines and quality standards during field operations.


Requirements


	Technical certificate or Diploma in Telecommunications, Electronics, or related field.
	2+ years of experience in fiber optic splicing and testing, preferably in FTTH environments.
	Proficient with fusion splicers, OTDRs, power meters, and cleaning tools.
	Familiarity with fiber color codes, fiber routing, and splitter connections.
	Ability to work in outdoor OSP environments ( poles, chambers).
	Attention to detail and commitment to quality workmanship.
	Basic reporting and record-keeping skills.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;reimerecruitment@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Fiber Splicing Technician Job at Reime West Africa




        
    

        
        Reime West Africa is afully owned subsidiary of a global brand with head office at Casablanca in Morocco that provides Telecom Infrastructure Development and Maintenance Services to Telecom companies in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Fiber Splicing Technician

Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports to: OSP Splicing Supervisor

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are hiring Fiber Optic Splicing Technicians to perform fiber splicing and testing on our customer FTTH deployment project in Ibadan.
	The technician will be responsible for ensuring accurate connections, low-loss joints, and high-quality signal delivery through field splicing activities.


Key Responsibilities


	Perform fusion splicing of optical fibers in ODFs, handholes, closures, and cabinets.
	Execute OTDR, power meter, and light source testing after splicing.
	Follow fiber jointing plans, splicing schedules, and color codes accurately.
	Install and organize fiber closures, splitters, pigtails, and splice trays.
	Ensure proper documentation of splice points, fiber routing, and test results.
	Troubleshoot and correct fiber signal loss or mismatches.
	Work closely with the splicing supervisor to meet daily targets.
	Maintain splicing tools and equipment in good condition.
	Adhere to safety guidelines and quality standards during field operations.


Requirements


	Technical certificate or Diploma in Telecommunications, Electronics, or related field.
	2+ years of experience in fiber optic splicing and testing, preferably in FTTH environments.
	Proficient with fusion splicers, OTDRs, power meters, and cleaning tools.
	Familiarity with fiber color codes, fiber routing, and splitter connections.
	Ability to work in outdoor OSP environments ( poles, chambers).
	Attention to detail and commitment to quality workmanship.
	Basic reporting and record-keeping skills.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: reimerecruitment@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "HSE Coordinator",
  "description": "Reime West Africa is afully owned subsidiary of a global brand with head office at Casablanca in Morocco that provides Telecom Infrastructure Development and Maintenance Services to Telecom companies in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HSE Coordinator

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports to: HSE Manager

Job Description


	As HSE Coordinator, you&rsquo;ll play a key role in supporting the delivery of our Health, Safety and Environmental strategy across site operations.
	Working closely with the HSE Manager and operational teams, you&rsquo;ll help to maintain compliance, promote a positive safety culture, and drive continuous improvement in all aspects of HSE performance.


Key Responsibilities


	Ensure the business maintains compliance with all applicable Health, Safety and Environmental (HSE) legislation
	Manage and maintain up to date policies, procedures, systems and data related to HSE that are understood and adopted across site operations
	Ensure site-wide surveillance walk rounds are conducted and support manager and staff with process and compliance auditing
	Advise management and staff on Health, Safety and Environmental matters arising in day to day operations.
	Coordinate and conduct HSE training and education programs for employees, contractors, and stakeholders, covering topics such as hazard recognition, emergency response, and risk mitigation.
	Ensure Health and Environmental Monitoring is carried out in accordance with company policy In collaboration with process owners, ensure Safe Operating Procedures are completed and made available to employees at point of use
	Ensure all accidents and incidents are recorded and fully investigated and that effective actions and controls are implemented to support learning and to prevent recurrence
	Manage the Safety &amp; Environmental Observations process ensuring that effective preventive controls are, identified and implemented, and that regular feedback is given to employees
	Liaise with other Company Health &amp; Safety employees to ensure consistent safety practices which are in-line with best practice
	Promote and advise on environmental legislative requirements, best practice, energy reduction and conservation throughout the company


Minimum Requirements / Qualifications


	Bachelor&#39;s Degree in Occupational Health and Safety, Environmental Science, Engineering, or related field
	NEBOSH General Certificate in Occupational Health &amp; Safety OR NVQ Level 3 in Occupational Health &amp; Safety
	NEBOSH Certificate in Environmental Management (Environmental Management Certificate) or equivalent


Experience:


	5yrs+ HSE experience is required.


Knowledge:


	A comprehensive knowledge of Nigeria Health &amp; Safety legislation


Skills &amp; Abilities:


	HSE management
	Regulatory compliance
	Risk assessment
	Incident investigation
	Training and education
	Communication
	Analytical thinking


Personal Attributes:


	Ability to work under pressure.
	Safety awareness
	Reliable and proactive
	Customer focused
	Results driven
	Team player


Salary
N350,000 - N400,000 / month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;reimerecruitment@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

HSE Coordinator Job at Reime West Africa




        
    

        
        Reime West Africa is afully owned subsidiary of a global brand with head office at Casablanca in Morocco that provides Telecom Infrastructure Development and Maintenance Services to Telecom companies in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HSE Coordinator

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports to: HSE Manager

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	As HSE Coordinator, you’ll play a key role in supporting the delivery of our Health, Safety and Environmental strategy across site operations.
	Working closely with the HSE Manager and operational teams, you’ll help to maintain compliance, promote a positive safety culture, and drive continuous improvement in all aspects of HSE performance.


Key Responsibilities


	Ensure the business maintains compliance with all applicable Health, Safety and Environmental (HSE) legislation
	Manage and maintain up to date policies, procedures, systems and data related to HSE that are understood and adopted across site operations
	Ensure site-wide surveillance walk rounds are conducted and support manager and staff with process and compliance auditing
	Advise management and staff on Health, Safety and Environmental matters arising in day to day operations.
	Coordinate and conduct HSE training and education programs for employees, contractors, and stakeholders, covering topics such as hazard recognition, emergency response, and risk mitigation.
	Ensure Health and Environmental Monitoring is carried out in accordance with company policy In collaboration with process owners, ensure Safe Operating Procedures are completed and made available to employees at point of use
	Ensure all accidents and incidents are recorded and fully investigated and that effective actions and controls are implemented to support learning and to prevent recurrence
	Manage the Safety & Environmental Observations process ensuring that effective preventive controls are, identified and implemented, and that regular feedback is given to employees
	Liaise with other Company Health & Safety employees to ensure consistent safety practices which are in-line with best practice
	Promote and advise on environmental legislative requirements, best practice, energy reduction and conservation throughout the company


Minimum Requirements / Qualifications


	Bachelor's Degree in Occupational Health and Safety, Environmental Science, Engineering, or related field
	NEBOSH General Certificate in Occupational Health & Safety OR NVQ Level 3 in Occupational Health & Safety
	NEBOSH Certificate in Environmental Management (Environmental Management Certificate) or equivalent


Experience:


	5yrs+ HSE experience is required.


Knowledge:


	A comprehensive knowledge of Nigeria Health & Safety legislation


Skills & Abilities:


	HSE management
	Regulatory compliance
	Risk assessment
	Incident investigation
	Training and education
	Communication
	Analytical thinking


Personal Attributes:


	Ability to work under pressure.
	Safety awareness
	Reliable and proactive
	Customer focused
	Results driven
	Team player


Salary
N350,000 - N400,000 / month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: reimerecruitment@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
